vehicles.description: A white van is located in the left lane, right in front of our vehicle, with its brake lights on, indicating that the vehicle is slowing down or has come to a stop.
vehicles.explanation: The behavior of the white van directly affects the following distance and speed of our vehicle, requiring readiness to stop or slow down at all times.

vehicles.description: There are several cars on the same lane and the adjacent lane, each at different distances.
vehicles.explanation: These vehicles may slow down or stop, requiring our vehicle to respond accordingly.

vehicles.description: On the far right, there is a white sedan parked.
vehicles.explanation: This vehicle is not currently directly affecting our driving route, but it needs to be monitored in case it moves.

other objects.description: A yellow traffic barricade equipped with reflective material is placed on the side of the road next to the right lane.
other objects.explanation: This object indicates that parking is prohibited near the driving lane.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the observed traffic scene, there are several vehicles and an object of interest that influence our autonomous driving behavior. To begin with, a white van has taken position directly ahead of our vehicle in the left lane, and has its brake lights illuminated, a clear sign that it is either decelerating or has already stopped. Consequently, our vehicle must maintain a safe following distance and be prepared to decelerate or come to a halt if necessary. Additional vehicles are present both within our lane and the adjacent one, each at varying proximities. The presence of these vehicles necessitates that our vehicle stay vigilant and ready to adjust speed or stop as they might exhibit similar behaviors. There is also a white sedan parked on the far right-hand side; although it does not presently interfere with our course, it warrants observation for any sudden movements.

Besides the vehicles, there is an object alongside the road—a yellow traffic barricade with reflective features—situated beside the right lane. The position and nature of the barricade suggest a no-parking zone adjacent to the driving lane, signaling to our vehicle to keep clear of that area. There are no vulnerable road users, traffic signs, traffic lights, traffic cones, or barriers present in this particular scenario.

driving_suggestion: Maintain a safe following distance from the white van ahead, and pay attention to its braking actions. Stay alert, as congestion may affect lane change decisions. Observe the traffic lights and be prepared to respond to signal changes. Carefully drive past yellow obstacles, being mindful of potential hazard areas or workers on the road. Keep a cautious speed, and be ready to slow down or change lanes if the white compact van encroaches on your lane. Maintain a safe distance from the vehicle in front, and always be aware of vehicles entering and exiting parking spaces. Proceed with caution at intersections, being aware that the green light may change, and watch for any unexpected behaviors from other road users.

1.description and explanation: This object is a traffic sign with a vertical rectangular shape, typically used to convey information or regulations to road users. Based on its position close to the road and the height at which it is installed, it is likely to indicate rules or directional commands that the ego car must adhere to for safe navigation of the area.

2.description and explanation: These objects are bollards, which are short, sturdy vertical posts. The purpose of these bollards is to prevent vehicles from entering or passing through certain areas, often used to separate pedestrian areas from vehicular traffic or to protect vulnerable structures. Their proximity to the roadway dictates that the ego car must maintain a safe distance to avoid collision.

3.description and explanation: This is a low, sturdy vertical structure, commonly known as a bollard. It is usually placed on roadsides or pathways to control or direct road traffic, serving as a barrier that can prevent vehicles from entering certain areas. For the ego car in this scenario, the presence of this bollard indicates that it should remain in the designated lane and avoid any maneuvers that may cause it to encroach upon the space near the bollard for safety reasons.
